page.title: 11Forestry and Vegetation
page.content: The block is fairly heavily wooded, with coniferous plantations and natural deciduous vegetation of trees and shrubs. In the forestry plantations all the trees are Sitka Spruce. They are managed on behalf of Ellary and Ormsary Estates by 2 independent management organisations. Some are newly planted, others are reaching maturity. In the deciduous woods there are many different trees. The varieties seen include lime, sycamore, willow, ash, alder, birch, hazel, oak, and rowan, with possibly willow emerging as the most common. There is also hawthorn, rhododendron, viburnum,and gorse. On the open hillside, heather is the most common plant, with bog myrtle and bracken quite extensive.
